topic: Go Directly to Jail: the Punitive Turn in America

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: It's no secret that the United States has one of the highest incarceration rates in the world, one that bears down especially hard on minorities. This course explores why that is so. It examines how scholars, journalists, film-makers, and novelists have explained the rise of mass incarceration and other punitive trends?"zero tolerance" in schools, for example-in the past half-century of US history. Students will learn how to understand, assess, and compare their explanations and how to speak and write effectively about them. They will encounter more reading than in most 300-level courses that I and others teach.
